p: To obtain information about C protein dynamics during the course of infection, it was necessary to study its behavior as a function of time. We compared the diffusion connectivity maps obtained from the 2D-pCF analysis in the nucleus of different cells at 3, 6, 18 and 25 hours post genomic RNA transfection. Figure 7a–d show average intensity images, and Fig. 7e–h show the corresponding connectivity maps. Nucleoli can be identified as brighter regions inside the nucleus and are delineated with dashed white lines as reference. At 3 h post viral RNA transfection C-mCherry is diffusing in the nucleus and a few pixels of positive correlation can be identified inside nucleoli. At 6 h the movement of C-mCherry around nucleolus becomes evident, and at 18 and 25 h a circulation around nucleoli can be clearly observed.
